name: uncatchable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If a person or a sports team are uncatchable, they are too fast or too skilled for others to reach, or they have too many points in a game or competition for others to beat: His speed and touch made him look uncatchable. They now have an uncatchable 10-point lead at the top of the league.
If an object, such as a ball, is uncatchable, it is impossible to catch it in your hands: The ball looked uncatchable.
More examplesFewer examplesHe extended his championship lead by six points to a seemingly uncatchable 24 points.She started the last lap with a seemingly uncatchable 35-second lead. Then they vanish, as uncatchable as mists and dandelion seeds.
